The bigger loss for the Patriots than Sunday’s home opener was watching tight end Aaron Hernandez leave with a severe right ankle injury in the first quarter.

In the wake of longtime director Elizabeth Ives Hunter’s exit, the Cape Cod Museum of Art has been facing the most public crisis of its three-decade history.

A private sector that cowers to political power is no longer an engine of growth. It is a ward of the state.

Video games dodge US slowdown

Despite the sluggish US economy, the Massachusetts video game industry keeps growing, according to a survey by Massachusetts Digital Games Institute.

With 51 days to go, the race between Senator Brown and Elizabeth Warren is a true tossup. The sparring sessions are over, and the real battle is about to begin.

iPhone 5 likely to boost data usage

Wireless carriers are reorganizing their data plans as features on the latest smartphones, including Apple Inc.’s new iPhone 5, appear likely to increase usage.
